intro: Heterostemma cucphuongense, commonly known as the Cuc Phuong heterostemma, is a rare flowering plant native to the Cuc Phuong National Park in Vietnam. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and distinct leaf morphology. The plant exhibits unique floral structures that contribute to its ecological significance in the region. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the specific microclimate of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
